{"step_by_step_thinking": "The quick SOFA (qSOFA) scoring system is used to identify patients who are at risk of developing sepsis. It consists of three components: altered mentation, systolic blood pressure (SBP) <= 100 mm Hg, and respiratory rate >= 22 breaths per minute. The Glasgow Coma Score is not a component of qSOFA. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Glasgow Coma Score.", "answer_choice": "C"}
